definition: to throw/to cast/left-slanting downward brush stroke (calligraphy)
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
lit. there is not even the first stroke of the character 八 (idiom)/fig. things have not even begun to take shape/no sign of success yet
lit. there is not even the first stroke of the character 八 (idiom)/fig. things have not even begun to take shape/no sign of success yet
pinyin: ba1 zi4 hai2 mei2 yi1 pie3

definition: lit. there is not even the first stroke of the character 八 (idiom)/fig. things have not even begun to take shape/no sign of success yet
pinyin: ba1 zi4 hai2 mei2 yi1 pie3 'r

definition: to skim froth or foam from the surface of a liquid
(Tw) trick (of the trade)/clever move/(Taiwanese, Tai-lo pr. [phiat-pōo])
to say a matter has no relationship with the individual referred to, to emphasise one is innocent or in the clear

sentences.english: He turned his toes out like Chaplin.
sentences.chinese: 他像卓别林那样把脚尖向外撇。

sentences.english: "I love the West, " she said. Her eyes were shining softly. She looked away and out the train window.
sentences.chinese: 她说，两眼流露着柔柔的光，撇过头望车窗的外面。

sentences.english: As soon as she became rich, she cast aside all her old friends.
sentences.chinese: 她一旦变富就把老朋友都撇了。

sentences.english: Her down-turned lips indicated her disagreement.
sentences.chinese: 她嘴角下撇，表示不同意。

sentences.english: He curled his lips in disdain.
He curled his lips in disdain.
All primed terms are initially zero for the experiments.
sentences.chinese: 所有右角带撇的项在这些实验开始时都为零。

sentences.english: And the water was spent in the bottle, and she cast the child under one of the shrubs.
sentences.chinese: 皮袋的水用尽了，夏甲就把孩子撇在小树底下。

sentences.english: Mrs. Otter, who did not like Clutton, pursed her lips.
sentences.chinese: 奥特尔太太撇了撇嘴，她不喜欢克拉顿。

sentences.english: In the lane he scored on power drop steps and right handed jump hooks over his left shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 在他攻入了对权力的下降和右撇子步跳投了他的左肩。

sentences.english: The querulous old man refused to be put on the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 那个爱抱怨的老人不肯让人撇在一边。

sentences.english: I played with two hands on one side and finally decided to play with righty.
sentences.chinese: 我在一侧玩两只手并且最后决定和右撇子玩。

sentences.english: He threw a look upward; puffs of cloud sat on a tissue-paper sky.
sentences.chinese: 他抬眼撇一下天，几缕云飘在棉纸般的空中。

sentences.english: The blue jade put on the sweat bead of putting on the forehead, Pie Pie mouth way.
sentences.chinese: 蓝玉抹了抹额头的汗珠，撇了撇嘴道。

sentences.english: Love coule not prevent god of death, He abandoned her to walk first.
sentences.chinese: 爱情阻挡不了死神的降临，他撇上下她一个人先走了。

sentences.english: Forgiveness allows you to live in the present and leave the past behind.
sentences.chinese: 原谅使得你活在当下，把过去撇在身后。

definition: to curl one's lip/to twitch one's mouth
to shoot a glance/glance/to appear in a flash
to disdain to do sth/to think sth not worth doing/to feel it beneath one's dignity
to cast sidelong glances at sb
to take aim/(fig.) to aim one's looks at/to glance at
like a smile yet not a smile (idiom)
to turn one's head/to turn around
